text: When using HubSpot site search, is it possible to have it crawl the main site and subdomains, or do we have to pick one?
It should crawl all your domains
If you would like to search across multiple domains, you need to add the query params
it doesnt look like that possible for the site search module though
You can clone the module and add any query params you need <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/content/search-for-content>
Can you give a more specific way of how this would be implemented within the javascript? This really only directs how you can use it for the API
I believe there are instructions in the site search input module for adding query params

are you talking about this?

`DEVELOPERS: You can set additional search parameters by adding hidden inputs like the example below. Both the typeahead and search results modules will accept these, except 'limit' which only works for results.`
So you can just add one of those for each domain you want to query and it should just work for all those domains

So it be something to the extent of:
`<input type="hidden" name="<http://www.mydomain.com|www.mydomain.com>" value="5">`

Referencing the API docs, the parameter would be the `name` in your example, like this: `<input type="hidden" name="domain" value="<http://www.mydomain.com|www.mydomain.com>">`

If you clone the default module and add the hidden input (you can add multiple of those) it will search those domains
